conditions.weatherComment: 13mm rain in the last 36 hours. Some sunny periods this morning, with a 10mph WNW wind and a high of 9c
conditions.other:
TRACK MAINTENANCE. This track was harrowed to a depth of 5", prior to the rain, on Wednesday and reinstated with a gallop master finish.
Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race NO ACCESS TO RACECOURSE WILL BE AVAILABLE UNTIL PASSING THROUGH THIS. PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING PHOTO ID. Please read BHA Guidelines regards the Resumption of Racing to be aware of what to prepare and expect on arrival. Hot meals will be provided for attendees & separately for Jockeys.

conditions.other:

Please read BHA Guidelines regards the Resumption of Racing to be aware of what to prepare and expect on arrival. Hot meals will be provided for attendees & separately for Jockeys.

conditions.weatherComment:
Tues: 5c Overcast with showers. 1-2mm
Weds: Top temp 5c and partly cloudy with odd light shower.
Thurs: 4c day time. Likely to be wet with 10-15mm of rain.
Fri: Wet start and damp throughout the day 5-10mm rain possible.
Sat: Overcast sunny spells 5c & dry.
Sun: Cold start poss -3c overcast all day. Top temps 3c.
Mon: Damp and milder poss 5/6c. 1-3mm of poss showers.
Tues 7c overcast with lights showers pm.

data.weather: 17mm up to 16.00pm Sunday. Outlook: 12-13mm daily Sunday. Showers Monday & Tuesday. Wednesday potentially 10-11mm.
data.other: Green zone screening continues to be via the back lane; testing is now at the entrance foyer for vehicles and marquee for horse boxes. Usual take away food service, additional seating in Marquee, and saddle drop outside the Weighing Room.

data.cotcInspectionText: Due to standing water in places & with further rain forecast, there is a risk of a waterlogged track.
data.weatherText: 18mm over weekend. 6mm Monday. Showers Tuesday. Dry Wednesday. Up to 5mm possible on raceday. (We have had 3mm up to race 1)
data.goingText: Heavy After the first chase today, the two ditches in back straight will now be bypassed due to ground under repair. (GoingStick:3.8 on 04-02-2021 at 08:00) Chase 4.0 Hurdle 3.5
data.inspectionsText: (Status: Passed) Precautionary Inspection to be held on Tuesday 02-02-2021 at 08:00 Due to standing water in places & with further rain forecast, there is a risk of a waterlogged track.
data.railText: Chase and Hurdle course in central positions. Rail moved out between 8-11 yards from the innermost position.

data.going: ABANDONED - Unsafe Course (Day of Racing) In light of the overnight rain and the forecast, the 8am will still have to take place.
data.weather: Dry and cool day on Monday. Snow on Tuesday (2"-3" in the end), which was followed by rain on Tuesday evening and overnight into Wednesday. This has resulted in c.25mm of precipitation in the last 24 hours. 3.5mm rain overnight into Thursday. Dry and overcast on Thursday. Further 4.5mm rain overnight into Friday. Dry and overcast during Friday. 5mm rain overnight into Saturday and now heavy rain forecast most of today, with c.10mm expected between 9am and the end of racing.
data.other: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

conditions.rails: The bottom bend is split for the chase and hurdle races.  The hurdle track has been moved out by 15 yards and the jump track by 9 yards to provide fresh ground.
conditions.weatherComment:
3 mm of rain overnight.  
Showery outbreaks of rain (up to 5 mm) will continue on Saturday, and as the colder air moves in later today, the risk of some sleet or perhaps snow increases.
Evening/ Overnight: Remaining mostly cloudy and breezy but a colder night and with further showers of sleet or snow pushing in across the area. Latest model data is erring towards colder temperatures (zero to -1 possible) and some ice/ snow accumulations look possible, anything from a dusting to 1 cm. 
Sunday will be a cold day with temperatures reaching a maximum +2 degrees during the day.  
Precautionary inspection 8 am on Sunday morning.
conditions.other: The hurdles and fences have been moved onto fresh ground, which has been saved for the Scottish Cheltenham Trials Weekend.

conditions.weatherComment: 6 mm of rain last 24 hours.  It will continue to be cold and windy with showers, heavy at times with 5-10 mm forecast on Wednesday, 5-10 mm on Thursday, 1-5 mm on Friday and 3-6 mm on Saturday.  Temperatures will be above zero until Saturday evening when they could fall to zero, which will increase the risk of snow (up to 1 to 2 cm of snow lying on Sunday).  Sunday will be a cold day with temperatures only reaching +2 degrees during the day.  The forecaster's confidence for snow accumulations at Musselburgh Racecourse on Sunday is low at this stage.

conditions.weatherComment: A windy week with rain and sleet on Tuesday (10-20 mm), Wednesday (5-10 mm), Thursday (3-7 mm) and Friday 1-3 mm).  There is a small chance of some snow during the week but accumulations are expected to be on higher ground. It turns more showery as the week progresses and into the weekend (1-5 mm).  Temperatures will be above zero until Saturday night when clearer skies could result in temperatures falling to -1 degrees creating a risk of frost and +3 degrees on Sunday.

conditions.groundComment: on the hurdle track
conditions.rails: The bottom bend is split for the chase and hurdle races.  The hurdle track has been moved out by 15 yards and the jump track by 9 yards to provide fresh ground.
conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight and +2 degrees. Remaining cloudy, breezy and cold on Sunday +2 degrees maximum. There will be some rain showers pushing in from the East (1 to 4 mm), which could fall as light snow.  Inspection passed at 7 am.
conditions.other: The hurdles and fences have been moved onto fresh ground, which has been saved for the Scottish Cheltenham Trials Weekend.
conditions.inspectionComment: Precautionary inspection for snow and frost at 8 am on Sunday morning.

conditions.groundComment: on the hurdle track

conditions.stablingComment: To book stables and accommodation for stable staff please email musselburghstables@gmail.com. Please book by 1 pm on Declarations Day.
conditions.bookingComment:
A qualified Vet will be on-course to provide a health certificate for horses travelling back to Ireland.  If you require a certificate please email the racecourse (musselburghstables@gmail.com) to advise us when you want to leave. 
Please ensure that all attendees complete the BHA Racing2Learn Education Module and the BHA Health Questionnaire.  
Restaurants closed in Musselburgh. There is a selection of takeaway outlets open.  Breakfasts and refreshments will be available in the Racecourse Bistro from 8 am.
conditions.inspectionComment: Precautionary inspection for snow and frost at 8 am on Sunday morning.

conditions.weatherComment:
3 mm of rain overnight.  
Showery outbreaks of rain (up to 5 mm) will continue on Saturday, and as the colder air moves in later today, the risk of some sleet or perhaps snow increases.
Evening/ Overnight: Remaining mostly cloudy and breezy but a colder night and with further showers of sleet or snow pushing in across the area. Latest model data is erring towards colder temperatures (zero to -1 possible) and some ice/ snow accumulations look possible, anything from a dusting to 1 cm. 
Sunday will be a cold day with temperatures reaching a maximum +2 degrees during the day.  
Precautionary inspection 8 am on Sunday morning.

data.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before first race, NO access allowed until passing through this and please remember your I.D and a face mask. Due to National Lockdown we regret Owners are not permitted. There is NO overnight stabling or accommodation available, lunch bags will be provided to all stable staff FOC, these will be available in the stable canteen, staff showers will be out of use for this meeting.

conditions.other:
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track was harrowed to a depth of 4 " on Sunday. It will be refreshed and reinstated with a gallop master finish.
Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race NO ACCESS TO RACECOURSE WILL BE AVAILABLE UNTIL PASSING THROUGH THIS. PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING PHOTO ID. Please read BHA Guidelines regards the Resumption of Racing to be aware of what to prepare and expect on arrival. Hot meals will be provided for attendees & separately for Jockeys.

data.going: ABANDONED - Frozen (Day of Racing) Abandoned due to moisture from a slight thaw of snow yesterday that subsequently caused some freezing in places. We will Continue to work on the track today and inspect at 1.30 for Saturday.
data.weather: Forecast: No more snow forecast. Thursday max daytime temp -1 with the possibility of some early sun, -4 overnight. Friday max daytime temp -1. Currently a good covering of snow (3-4cm) and sub zero temperatures forecast. Will continue to monitor and update.
data.other: The track will be de-compacted and gallop master finished for race day subject to the ability to clear the snow.

conditions.groundComment:
RACING GOES AHEAD
Going changed this morning. Working slightly deeper due to temperatures, but polytrack is completely frost free.
conditions.weatherComment:
Reached -5.7C last night. Currently -3.8C.
Forecast: some sunny spells this morning but remaining below freezing for most of the day. Cloud thickening into the afternoon with a moderate breeze.
conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Food is available in the Brasserie (not the stable canteen).

data.cotcInspectionText: Frozen places. Light snow showers are forecast Saturday. Temperatures are rising on Sunday. This may not give the track enough time to thaw.
data.weatherText: Raining and currently 6c plus. Due to be +7c by racing. No fresh frost.
data.goingText: Heavy, Soft (in places) After 7mm since the start of racing. Hurdles course fit for racing & second inspection passed. Chase races abandoned. Hurdle races to run at scheduled times.
data.inspectionsText: (Status: Failed) (Status: Passed) Inspection to be held on Sunday 14-02-2021 at 11:00 We are satisfied with Hurdles and need to review Chase, significant improvement Inspection to be held on Sunday 14-02-2021 at 08:30 Frozen places. Light snow showers are forecast Saturday. Temperatures are rising on Sunday. This may not give the track enough time to thaw.

conditions.groundComment: JUMPERS BUMPERS FIXTURE - Going: Standard to Slow
conditions.weatherComment:
5mm rain in the past 24 hours.
Forecast: Showers this morning, turning cloudy with a moderate breeze. Max temperatures 11C.
conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Food is available in the Brasserie (not the stable canteen).

Trainers and all Racing Staff are reminded of the importance of STABLE HYGEINE.
ALL RUBBISH, including unused hay and feed, MUST be placed in bins provided and not left scattered around the yard.
Your co-operation with this will be appreciated.

Temperatures of up to +10C by lunchtime Monday, on a mostly cloudy day with a southerly breeze.

conditions.rails: The Away bend will be operated as a single, shared hurdle and chase bend for this meeting, with rail set at the innermost (official) line for the Chase course, therefore the hurdle course will be located 24 yds in from its official line. The normally shared 'A1'bend is also located on its innermost (official) line. The effect on race distances is as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
Low of -5C overnight into Thursday. Cold, overcast and only +2C on Thursday. Low of -5C overnight into Friday. Dry and bright day forecast for Friday, top temp of +2C. -2C overnight into Saturday. Dry and cold during Saturday. Low of 0C on Saturday night into Sunday. +4C overnight and 4mm into Monday. 1mm rain overnight into Tuesday, then a dry day, with sunny spells and 12C. 1.5mm rain overnight into Wednesday.

conditions.stablingComment:
Please note that the testing station will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Access for ALL is through main entrance off the B1224 (York Road), near Junction 46 of the A1(M). WALTON ROAD ENTRANCE WILL NOT BE OPEN.

NO ACCESS TO GREEN ZONE WILL BE AVAILABLE UNTIL PASSING THROUGH THE TESTING STATION. There is one Testing station in operation, which is located just before of the stable yard.

PLEASE REMEMBER TO BRING PHOTO ID. Please read BHA Guidelines regards the Resumption of Racing to be aware of what to prepare and expect on arrival.
conditions.bookingComment: Due to Covid-19 restrictions, there is no overnight accommodation on site however, assistance can be provided if off-site accommodation is required.

conditions.weatherComment:
Some light snow in the past 24 hours (everything covered). Currently -1.4C 
Forecast: will struggle to rise above freezing all week. Wednesday evening will get down to -7C and currently -4C on Friday evening, with highs of 0C on raceday.
conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Food is available in the Brasserie (not the stable canteen).
conditions.stablingComment:
Trainers and all Racing Staff are reminded of the importance of STABLE HYGEINE.
ALL RUBBISH, including unused hay and feed, MUST be placed in bins provided and not left scattered around the yard.
Your co-operation with this will be appreciated.
conditions.bookingComment: For overnight accommodation please contact Stephanie Wethered (Trainee Clerk & Racing Executive) on swethered@lingfieldpark.co.uk or 07977 435569 following declarations.

conditions.weatherComment:
Monday: cloudy day with a small chance of showers.
Tuesday: cold start turning into a dry and bright day. 
Outlook: settled forecast with a chance of rain later in the week.
conditions.other:
Green Zone Access 
The testing station, located at the entrance to the horse box park, will be open from 5 hours before the first race.
 
Owners Badges
Owners must pre-book tickets before arrival in order to comply with local track & trace protocols. For all badge requests (up to four badges per runner) please e-mail info@kelso-races.co.uk or call the racecourse office on 01573 221221. The owners’ entrance will be open from 1 hour before racing at the regular Owners and Trainers entrance near the main gate. 
 
Please remember to bring your Photo ID

conditions.weatherComment: Currently 4 inches of snow on the ground. Bitterly cold last few nights and days but snow has kept the frost out of the ground. Forecast: continues to be cold over the weekend but with no more snow. The warms up from Monday with some light rain and day temps +7 on Tues with none freezing nights. Snow should thaw but will leave testing ground.
conditions.other: It has been a very cold and snowy week but the forecast looks promising for next week. Fingers crossed. Stay warm and happy over the weekend and if you have any questions please call me on 07767 802206. David

conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Food is available in the Brasserie (not the stable canteen).

conditions.weatherComment:
Some light snow in the past 24 hours (everything covered). Currently -1.4C 
Forecast: will struggle to rise above freezing all week. Wednesday evening will get down to -7C and currently -4C on Friday evening, with highs of 0C on raceday.
conditions.other: Testing stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. Trainers, jockeys & officials are to park in the O&T car park opposite the main entrance off of racecourse road. Food is available in the Brasserie (not the stable canteen).
conditions.stablingComment:
Trainers and all Racing Staff are reminded of the importance of STABLE HYGEINE.
ALL RUBBISH, including unused hay and feed, MUST be placed in bins provided and not left scattered around the yard.
Your co-operation with this will be appreciated.
conditions.bookingComment: For overnight accommodation please contact Stephanie Wethered (Trainee Clerk & Racing Executive) on swethered@lingfieldpark.co.uk or 07977 435569 following declarations.

conditions.groundComment: After racing on Tuesday 16th entire AW surface will be ripped up (turned over) & reinstated for racing on Saturday 20th so will ride on slow side
conditions.weatherComment:
Sat: 10/12c overcast with odd showers later. 2-4mm. Stiff winds (southerly)
Sun: 10c Moderate winds in south again
Mon: 8c Light winds in south odd light shower
Tues: 9c overcast sunny spells chance of showers pm 1-2mm
Weds: 14c Overcast stiff southerly wind.
Thurs: 11c Sunny spells. Stiff winds remain in S/W
Fri: 9c sunny Moderate winds in West
Sat: Overcast and cooler around 9c by afternoon. Light winds in SW
conditions.other: COVID: NATIONAL LOCKDOWN

conditions.groundComment: After racing on Tuesday 16th entire AW surface will be ripped up (turned over) & reinstated for racing on Saturday 20th so will ride on slow side
conditions.weatherComment:
Mon: 9c later today. Moderate Winds in south.
Tues: 10c by day with odd light rain showers, moderate winds in south
Weds: 4c overcast with rain likely late afternoon. Winds in south
Thurs: 7/8c Overcast with rain am 2-4mm. Stiff southerly wind
Fri: 8c overcast sunny spells with moderate winds in south
Sat: 10/12c windy (southerly)
Sun: 13c winds in south again
conditions.other: COVID: NATIONAL LOCKDOWN
conditions.stablingComment:
Overnight stabling and staff accommodation is available the
night before or night after at The Grand Hotel. *Please ensure you book by email
jarmstrong@newcastle-racecourse.co.uk NO LATER than 24hrs before
planned arrival so suitable accomodation can be arranged.
conditions.bookingComment:
Please note that the testing station will be open from 5hrs
before the first race. No access to the racecourse will be
available until passing through this check point. PLEASE
REMEMBER TO BRING ID .

conditions.weatherComment:
2mm of rain Thursday.
Cloudy with a chance of light showers around midday, highs of 11C.

The screening stations will be open from 5 hours before the first race. All vehicles will enter via the main public car park off Legsby road to be screened and accredited. Please remember to bring your photo ID. Key information: 
- A colours bag drop-off/collection point is located to the side of the Red Rum bar. 
- Complimentary food for stable staff and trainers will be available from the Red Rum bar. Please note a voucher system will be in place, additional purchases will be available by card payment only.

conditions.rails: The 'Away' bend will be operated as a single, shared hurdle and chase bend for this meeting, with the rail set 5yds out from the innermost (official) line of the chase course, therefore meaning that the hurdle course will be located 19yds in from its official line.  The normally shared A1 Bend is located 5yds out from its innermost (official) line. The effect on race distances are as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
2.5mm rain overnight into Thursday, then a dry and settled day. Friday was damp and wet in the morning, then overcast for the remainder of the day. 2.5mm rain overnight into Saturday. Saturday was a calm and overcast day. Dry overnight into Sunday. 3mm rain early on Monday morning, stopping around 10am, then dry, bright and warm(ish) afternoon. Dry overnight into Tuesday.
Forecast is dry and settled through until the end of racing, except very slight chance of a light shower during this morning.  Breezy day.
conditions.other: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

Forecast: Possible light showers this morning, less than 1mm, followed by another dry day, sunny spells and 10C.
